block.p: U2 was the most popular concert tour in 2005, according to two ways of measuring data. Based on a combination of ticket sales, Internet page views and requests for information, U2 made it to the top of the above list, compiled by Ticketmaster. And according to Billboard Boxscore, U2 sold out all of its 92 concerts in its 2005 Vertigo tour, and brought in $260 million in gross receipts, more than any other act. The Dave Matthews Band (above) is No. 4 on the Ticketmaster list and earned $45 million.
